name: Writing Women in Premodern China
description: A survey of premodern Chinese texts (before 1700) in translation, written by women, about women, and in the voices ofwomen, across a variety of genres drawn from literature, history, philosophy, and religion. The texts provideopportunities to explore how gender was constructed in Chinese societies, how women were defined and constrainedby texts, and how women used writing to express themselves, often in resistance to dominant modes of representation.
